nz.govt.natlib.fx
Class DateElement

java.lang.Object
  nz.govt.natlib.fx.Element
      nz.govt.natlib.fx.DateElement

public class DateElement
extends Element

Reads bytes and converts them to a Java Date according to a date pattern. the pattern is standard UTF timecodes eg: 

  Symbol   Meaning                 Presentation        Example
  ------   -------                 ------------        -------
  G        era designator          (Text)              AD
  y        year                    (Number)            1996
  M        month in year           (Text & Number)     July & 07
  d        day in month            (Number)            10
  h        hour in am/pm (1˜12)    (Number)            12
  H        hour in day (0˜23)      (Number)            0
  m        minute in hour          (Number)            30
  s        second in minute        (Number)            55
  S        millisecond             (Number)            978
  E        day in week             (Text)              Tuesday
  D        day in year             (Number)            189
  F        day of week in month    (Number)            2 (2nd Wed in July)
  w        week in year            (Number)            27
  W        week in month           (Number)            2
  a        am/pm marker            (Text)              PM
  k        hour in day (1˜24)      (Number)            24
  K        hour in am/pm (0˜11)    (Number)            0
  z        time zone               (Text)              Pacific Standard Time
  '        escape for text         (Delimiter)
  ''       single quote            (Literal)           '
 
  Examples
  Format Pattern                         Result
  --------------                         -------
  "yyyy.MM.dd G 'at' hh:mm:ss z"    ->>  1996.07.10 AD at 15:08:56 PDT
  "EEE, MMM d, ''yy"                ->>  Wed, July 10, '96
  "h:mm a"                          ->>  12:08 PM
  "hh 'o''clock' a, zzzz"           ->>  12 o'clock PM, Pacific Daylight Time
  "K:mm a, z"                       ->>  0:00 PM, PST
  "yyyyy.MMMMM.dd GGG hh:mm aaa"    ->>  1996.July.10 AD 12:08 PM *








Version:

  
1.0


Author:

  
Nic Evans

Constructor Detail







DateElement


public DateElement(java.lang.String pattern)




Note: the pattern MUST be the same length as the data to be checked. The
 pattern should be standard UTF codes for date/time





Parameters:
pattern - The pattern to be applied to the bytes.

The pattern to be applied to the bytes. The pattern should be standard
 UTF codes for date/time





Parameters:
pattern - The pattern to be applied to the bytes.
length - the length of the bytes to be parsed.
